1.name: Certificate of analysis
1.desc: Certificate providing the values of an analysis.

2.name: Certificate of conformity
2.desc: Certificate certifying the conformity to predefined definitions.

3.name: Certificate of quality
3.desc: Certificate certifying the quality of goods, services etc.

4.name: Test report
4.desc: Report providing the results of a test session.

5.name: Product performance report
5.desc: Report specifying the performance values of products.

6.name: Product specification report
6.desc: Report providing specification values of products.

7.name: Process data report
7.desc: Reports on events during production process.

10.name: Party information
10.desc: Document/message providing basic data concerning a party.

12.name: Mill certificate
12.desc: Certificate certifying a specific quality of agricultural products.

13.name: Post receipt
13.desc: Document/message which evidences the transport of goods by post (e.g. mail, parcel, etc.).

14.name: Weight certificate
14.desc: Certificate certifying the weight of goods.

15.name: Weight list
15.desc: Document/message specifying the weight of goods.

16.name: Certificate
16.desc: Document by means of which the documentary credit applicant specifies the conditions for the certificate and by whom the certificate is to be issued.

17.name: Combined certificate of value and origin
17.desc: Document identifying goods, in which the authority empowered to issue it certifies expressly that the goods to which the respective goods originate in a specific (part of or group of) country(ies). It also states the price and/or costs of the goods with the purpose of determining the Customs value.

18.name: Movement certificate A.TR.1
18.desc: Specific form of transit declaration issued by the exporter (movement certificate).

19.name: Certificate of quantity
19.desc: Certificate certifying the quantity of goods, services etc.

23.name: Status information
23.desc: Information regarding the status of a related message.

24.name: Restow
24.desc: Message/document identifying containers that have been unloaded and then reloaded onto the same means of transport.

25.name: Container discharger list
25.desc: Message/document itemising containers to be discharged from vessel.

26.name: Corporate superannuation contributions advice
26.desc: Document/message providing contributions advice used for corporate superannuation schemes.

27.name: Industry superannuation contributions advice
27.desc: Document/message providing contributions advice used for superannuation schemes which are industry wide.

28.name: Corporate superannuation member maintenance message
28.desc: Member maintenance message used for corporate superannuation schemes.

29.name: Industry superannuation member maintenance message
29.desc: Member maintenance message used for industry wide superannuation schemes.

30.name: Life insurance payroll deductions advice
30.desc: Payroll deductions advice used in the life insurance industry.

31.name: Underbond request
31.desc: A Message/document requesting to move cargo from one Customs control point to another.

32.name: Underbond approval
32.desc: A message/document issuing Customs approval to move cargo from one Customs control point to another.

33.name: Certificate of sealing of export meat lockers
33.desc: Document / message issued by the authority in the exporting country evidencing the sealing of export meat lockers.

34.name: Cargo status
34.desc: Message identifying the status of cargo.

35.name: Inventory report
35.desc: A message specifying information relating to held inventories.

37.name: Response to a trade statistics message
37.desc: Document/message in which the competent national authorities provide a declarant with an acceptance or a rejection about a received declaration for European statistical purposes.

59.name: Treatment - nil outturn
59.desc: No shortage, surplus or damaged outturn resulting from container vessel unpacking.

60.name: Treatment - time-up underbond
60.desc: Movement type indicator: goods are moved under customs control for warehousing due to being time-up.

61.name: Treatment - underbond by sea
61.desc: Movement type indicator: goods are to move by sea under customs control to a customs office where formalities will be completed.

64.name: Preliminary credit assessment
64.desc: Document/message issued either by a factor to indicate his preliminary credit assessment on a buyer, or by a seller to request a factor's preliminary credit assessment on a buyer.

65.name: Credit cover
65.desc: Document/message issued either by a factor to give a credit cover on a buyer, or by a seller to request a factor's credit cover.

66.name: Current account
66.desc: Document/message issued by a factor to indicate the money movements of a seller's or another factor's account with him.

67.name: Commercial dispute
67.desc: Document/message issued by a party (usually the buyer) to indicate that one or more invoices or one or more credit notes are disputed for payment.

68.name: Chargeback
68.desc: Document/message issued by a factor to a seller or to another factor to indicate that the rest of the amounts of one or more invoices uncollectable from buyers are charged back to clear the invoice(s) off the ledger.

69.name: Reassignment
69.desc: Document/message issued by a factor to a seller or to another factor to reassign an invoice or credit note previously assigned to him.

70.name: Collateral account
70.desc: Document message issued by a factor to indicate the movements of invoices, credit notes and payments of a seller's account.

71.name: Request for payment
71.desc: Document/message issued by a creditor to a debtor to request payment of one or more invoices past due.

72.name: Unship permit
72.desc: A message or document issuing permission to unship cargo.

73.name: Statistical definitions
73.desc: Transmission of one or more statistical definitions.

74.name: Statistical data
74.desc: Transmission of one or more items of data or data sets.

75.name: Request for statistical data
75.desc: Request for one or more items or data sets of statistical data.

76.name: Call-off delivery
76.desc: Document/message to provide split quantities and delivery dates referring to a previous delivery instruction.

77.name: Status report
77.desc: Message covers information about the consignment status.

80.name: Debit note related to goods or services
80.desc: Debit information related to a transaction for goods or services to the relevant party.

81.name: Credit note related to goods or services
81.desc: Document message used to provide credit information related to a transaction for goods or services to the relevant party.

82.name: Metered services invoice
82.desc: Document/message claiming payment for the supply of metered services (e.g., gas, electricity, etc.) supplied to a fixed meter whose consumption is measured over a period of time.

83.name: Credit note related to financial adjustments
83.desc: Document message for providing credit information related to financial adjustments to the relevant party, e.g., bonuses.

84.name: Debit note related to financial adjustments
84.desc: Document/message for providing debit information related to financial adjustments to the relevant party.

85.name: Customs manifest
85.desc: Message/document identifying a customs manifest. The document itemises a list of cargo prepared by shipping companies from bills of landing and presented to customs for formal report of cargo.

86.name: Vessel unpack report
86.desc: A document code to indicate that the message being transmitted identifies all short and surplus cargoes off- loaded from a vessel at a specified discharging port.

87.name: General cargo summary manifest report
87.desc: A document code to indicate that the message being transmitted is summary manifest information for general cargo.

88.name: Consignment unpack report
88.desc: A document code to indicate that the message being transmitted is a consignment unpack report only.

89.name: Meat and meat by-products sanitary certificate
89.desc: Document or message issued by the competent authority in the exporting country evidencing that meat or meat by- products comply with the requirements set by the importing country.

90.name: Meat food products sanitary certificate
90.desc: Document or message issued by the competent authority in the exporting country evidencing that meat food products comply with the requirements set by the importing country.

91.name: Poultry sanitary certificate
91.desc: Document or message issued by the competent authority in the exporting country evidencing that poultry products comply with the requirements set by the importing country.

92.name: Horsemeat sanitary certificate
92.desc: Document or message issued by the competent authority in the exporting country evidencing that horsemeat products comply with the requirements set by the importing country.

93.name: Casing sanitary certificate
93.desc: Document or message issued by the competent authority in the exporting country evidencing that casing products comply with the requirements set by the importing country.

94.name: Pharmaceutical sanitary certificate
94.desc: Document or message issued by the competent authority in the exporting country evidencing that pharmaceutical products comply with the requirements set by the importing country.

95.name: Inedible sanitary certificate
95.desc: Document or message issued by the competent authority in the exporting country evidencing that inedible products comply with the requirements set by the importing country.

96.name: Impending arrival
96.desc: Notification of impending arrival details for vessel.

97.name: Means of transport advice
97.desc: Message reporting the means of transport used to carry goods or cargo.

98.name: Arrival information
98.desc: Message reporting the arrival details of goods or cargo.

99.name: Cargo release notification
99.desc: Message/document sent by the cargo handler indicating that the cargo has moved from a Customs controlled premise.

105.name: Purchase order
105.desc: Document/message issued within an enterprise to initiate the purchase of articles, materials or services required for the production or manufacture of goods to be offered for sale or otherwise supplied to customers.

110.name: Manufacturing instructions
110.desc: Document/message issued within an enterprise to initiate the manufacture of goods to be offered for sale.

120.name: Stores requisition
120.desc: Document/message issued within an enterprise ordering the taking out of stock of goods.

130.name: Invoicing data sheet
130.desc: Document/message issued within an enterprise containing data about goods sold, to be used as the basis for the preparation of an invoice.

140.name: Packing instructions
140.desc: Document/message within an enterprise giving instructions on how goods are to be packed.

150.name: Internal transport order
150.desc: Document/message giving instructions about the transport of goods within an enterprise.

190.name: Statistical and other administrative internal documents
190.desc: Documents/messages issued within an enterprise for the for the purpose of collection of production and other internal statistics, and for other administration purposes.

201.name: Direct payment valuation request
201.desc: Request to establish a direct payment valuation.

202.name: Direct payment valuation
202.desc: Document/message addressed, for instance, by a general contractor to the owner, in order that a direct payment be made to a subcontractor.

203.name: Provisional payment valuation
203.desc: Document/message establishing a provisional payment valuation.

204.name: Payment valuation
204.desc: Document/message establishing the financial elements of a situation of works.

205.name: Quantity valuation
205.desc: Document/message providing a confirmed assessment, by quantity, of the completed work for a construction contract.

206.name: Quantity valuation request
206.desc: Document/message providing an initial assessment, by quantity, of the completed work for a construction contract.

207.name: Contract bill of quantities - BOQ
207.desc: Document/message providing a formal specification identifying quantities and prices that are the basis of a contract for a construction project. BOQ means: Bill of quantity.

208.name: Unpriced tender BOQ
208.desc: Document/message providing a detailed, quantity based specification, issued in an unpriced form to invite tender prices. BOQ means: Bill of quantity.

209.name: Priced tender BOQ
209.desc: Document/message providing a detailed, quantity based specification, updated with prices to form a tender submission for a construction contract. BOQ means: Bill of quantity.

210.name: Enquiry
210.desc: Document/message issued by a party interested in the purchase of goods specified therein and indicating particular, desirable conditions regarding delivery terms, etc., addressed to a prospective supplier with a view to obtaining an offer.

211.name: Interim application for payment
211.desc: Document/message containing a provisional assessment in support of a request for payment for completed work for a construction contract.

212.name: Agreement to pay
212.desc: Document/message in which the debtor expresses the intention to pay.

215.name: Letter of intent
215.desc: Document/message by means of which a buyer informs a seller that the buyer intends to enter into contractual negotiations.

220.name: Order
220.desc: Document/message by means of which a buyer initiates a transaction with a seller involving the supply of goods or services as specified, according to conditions set out in an offer, or otherwise known to the buyer.

221.name: Blanket order
221.desc: Usage of document/message for general order purposes with later split into quantities and delivery dates and maybe delivery locations.

222.name: Spot order
222.desc: Document/message ordering the remainder of a production's batch.

223.name: Lease order
223.desc: Document/message for goods in leasing contracts.

225.name: Repair order
225.desc: Document/message to order repair of goods.

226.name: Call off order
226.desc: Document/message to provide split quantities and delivery dates referring to a previous blanket order.

227.name: Consignment order
227.desc: Order to deliver goods into stock with agreement on payment when goods are sold out of this stock.

229.name: Swap order
229.desc: Document/message informing buyer or seller of the replacement of goods previously ordered.

230.name: Purchase order change request
230.desc: Change to an purchase order already sent.

231.name: Purchase order response
231.desc: Response to an purchase order already received.

232.name: Hire order
232.desc: Document/message for hiring human resources or renting goods or equipment.

240.name: Delivery instructions
240.desc: Document/message issued by a buyer giving instructions regarding the details of the delivery of goods ordered.

245.name: Delivery release
245.desc: Document/message issued by a buyer releasing the despatch of goods after receipt of the Ready for despatch advice from the seller.

270.name: Delivery note
270.desc: Paper document attached to a consignment informing the receiving party about contents of this consignment.

271.name: Packing list
271.desc: Document/message specifying the distribution of goods in individual packages (in trade environment the despatch advice message is used for the packing list).

310.name: Offer/quotation
310.desc: Document/message which , with a view to concluding a contract, sets out the conditions under which the goods are offered.

311.name: Request for quote
311.desc: Document/message requesting a quote on specified goods or services.

315.name: Contract
315.desc: Document/message evidencing an agreement between the seller and the buyer for the supply of goods or services; its effects are equivalent to those of an order followed by an acknowledgement of order.

320.name: Acknowledgement of order
320.desc: Document/message acknowledging an undertaking to fulfil an order and confirming conditions or acceptance of conditions.

325.name: Proforma invoice
325.desc: Document/message serving as a preliminary invoice, containing - on the whole - the same information as the final invoice, but not actually claiming payment.

328.name: Name/product plate
328.desc: Plates on goods identifying and describing an article.

330.name: Request for delivery instructions
330.desc: Document/message issued by a supplier requesting instructions from the buyer regarding the details of the delivery of goods ordered.

335.name: Booking request
335.desc: Document/message issued by a supplier to a carrier requesting space to be reserved for a specified consignment, indicating desirable conveyance, despatch time, etc.

340.name: Shipping instructions
340.desc: Document/message advising details of cargo and exporter's requirements for its physical movement.

341.name: Shipper's letter of instructions (air)
341.desc: Document/message issued by a consignor in which he gives details of a consignment of goods that enables an airline or its agent to prepare an air waybill.

343.name: Cartage order (local transport)
343.desc: Document/message giving instructions regarding local transport of goods, e.g. from the premises of an enterprise to those of a carrier undertaking further transport.

345.name: Ready for despatch advice
345.desc: Document/message issued by a supplier informing a buyer that goods ordered are ready for despatch.

350.name: Despatch order
350.desc: Document/message issued by a supplier initiating the despatch of goods to a buyer (consignee).

351.name: Despatch advice
351.desc: Document/message by means of which the seller or consignor informs the consignee about the despatch of goods.

370.name: Advice of distribution of documents
370.desc: Document/message in which the party responsible for the issue of a set of trade documents specifies the various recipients of originals and copies of these documents, with an indication of the number of copies distributed to each of them.

380.name: Commercial invoice
380.desc: Document/message claiming payment for goods or services supplied under conditions agreed between seller and buyer.

381.name: Credit note
381.desc: Document/message for providing credit information to the relevant party.

382.name: Commission note
382.desc: Document/message in which a seller specifies the amount of commission, the percentage of the invoice amount, or some other basis for the calculation of the commission to which a sales agent is entitled.

383.name: Debit note
383.desc: Document/message for providing debit information to the relevant party.

384.name: Corrected invoice
384.desc: Commercial invoice that includes revised information differing from an earlier submission of the same invoice.

385.name: Consolidated invoice
385.desc: Commercial invoice that covers multiple transactions involving more than one vendor.

386.name: Prepayment invoice
386.desc: An invoice to pay amounts for goods and services in advance; these amounts will be subtracted from the final invoice.

387.name: Hire invoice
387.desc: Document/message for invoicing the hiring of human resources or renting goods or equipment.

389.name: Self-billed invoice
389.desc: An invoice the invoicee is producing instead of the seller.

390.name: Delcredere invoice
390.desc: An invoice sent to the party paying for a number of buyers.

393.name: Factored invoice
393.desc: Invoice assigned to a third party for collection.

394.name: Lease invoice
394.desc: Usage of INVOIC-message for goods in leasing contracts.

395.name: Consignment invoice
395.desc: Commercial invoice that covers a transaction other than one involving a sale.

396.name: Factored credit note
396.desc: Credit note related to assigned invoice(s).

409.name: Instructions for bank transfer
409.desc: Document/message containing instructions from a customer to his bank to pay an amount in a specified currency to a nominated party in another country by a method either specified (e.g. teletransmission, air mail) or left to the discretion of the bank.

412.name: Application for banker's draft
412.desc: Application by a customer to his bank to issue a banker's draft stating the amount and currency of the draft, the name of the payee and the place and country of payment.

425.name: Collection payment advice
425.desc: Document/message whereby a bank advises that a collection has been paid, giving details and methods of funds disposal.

426.name: Documentary credit payment advice
426.desc: Document/message whereby a bank advises payment under a documentary credit.

427.name: Documentary credit acceptance advice
427.desc: Document/message whereby a bank advises acceptance under a documentary credit.

428.name: Documentary credit negotiation advice
428.desc: Document/message whereby a bank advises negotiation under a documentary credit.

429.name: Application for banker's guarantee
429.desc: Document/message whereby a customer requests his bank to issue a guarantee in favour of a nominated party in another country, stating the amount and currency and the specific conditions of the guarantee.

430.name: Banker's guarantee
430.desc: Document/message in which a bank undertakes to pay out a limited amount of money to a designated party, on conditions stated therein (other than those laid down in the Uniform Customs Practice).

431.name: Documentary credit letter of indemnity
431.desc: Document/message in which a beneficiary of a documentary credit accepts responsibility for non-compliance with the terms and conditions of the credit, and undertakes to refund the money received under the credit, with interest and charges accrued.

435.name: Preadvice of a credit
435.desc: Preadvice indicating a credit to happen in the future.

447.name: Collection order
447.desc: Document/message whereby a bank is instructed (or requested) to handle financial and/or commercial documents in order to obtain acceptance and/or payment, or to deliver documents on such other terms and conditions as may be specified.

448.name: Documents presentation form
448.desc: Document/message whereby a draft or similar instrument and/or commercial documents are presented to a bank for acceptance, discounting, negotiation, payment or collection, whether or not against a documentary credit.

450.name: Payment order
450.desc: Document/message containing information needed to initiate the payment. It may cover the financial settlement for one or more commercial trade transactions. A payment order is an instruction to the ordered bank to arrange for the payment of one specified amount to the beneficiary.

451.name: Extended payment order
451.desc: Document/message containing information needed to initiate the payment. It may cover the financial settlement for several commercial trade transactions, which it is possible to specify in a special payments detail part. It is an instruction to the ordered bank to arrange for the payment of one specified amount to the beneficiary.

452.name: Multiple payment order
452.desc: Document/message containing a payment order with one debit account and several credit accounts.

454.name: Credit advice
454.desc: Document/message sent by an account servicing institution to one of its account owners, to inform the account owner of an entry which has been or will be credited to its account for a specified amount on the date indicated.

455.name: Extended credit advice
455.desc: Document/message sent by an account servicing institution to one of its account owners, to inform the account owner of an entry that has been or will be credited to its account for a specified amount on the date indicated. It provides extended commercial information concerning the relevant remittance advice.

457.name: Reversal of debit
457.desc: Reversal of debit accounting entry by bank.

458.name: Reversal of credit
458.desc: Reversal of credit accounting entry by bank.

460.name: Documentary credit application
460.desc: Document/message whereby a bank is requested to issue a documentary credit on the conditions specified therein.

465.name: Documentary credit
465.desc: Document/message in which a bank states that it has issued a documentary credit under which the beneficiary is to obtain payment, acceptance or negotiation on compliance with certain terms and conditions and against presentation of stipulated documents and such drafts as may be specified. The credit may or may not be confirmed by another bank.

466.name: Documentary credit notification
466.desc: Document/message issued by an advising bank in order to transmit a documentary credit to a beneficiary, or to another advising bank.

467.name: Documentary credit transfer advice
467.desc: Document/message whereby a bank advises that (part of) a documentary credit is being or has been transferred in favour of a second beneficiary.

468.name: Documentary credit amendment notification
468.desc: Document/message whereby a bank advises that the terms and conditions of a documentary credit have been amended.

469.name: Documentary credit amendment
469.desc: Document/message whereby a bank notifies a beneficiary of the details of an amendment to the terms and conditions of a documentary credit.

481.name: Remittance advice
481.desc: Document/message advising of the remittance of payment.

485.name: Banker's draft
485.desc: Draft drawn in favour of a third party either by one bank on another bank, or by a branch of a bank on its head office (or vice versa) or upon another branch of the same bank. In either case, the draft should comply with the specifications laid down for cheques in the country in which it is to be payable.

490.name: Bill of exchange
490.desc: Document/message, issued and signed in conformity with the applicable legislation, which contains an unconditional order whereby the drawer directs the drawee to pay a definite sum of money to the payee or to his order, on demand or at a definite time, against the surrender of the document itself.

491.name: Promissory note
491.desc: Document/message, issued and signed in conformity with the applicable legislation, which contains an unconditional promise whereby the maker undertakes to pay a definite sum of money to the payee or to his order, on demand or at a definite time, against the surrender of the document itself.

492.name: Financial statement of account
492.desc: Statement giving the status of a financial account.

520.name: Insurance certificate
520.desc: Document/message issued to the insured certifying that insurance has been effected and that a policy has been issued. Such a certificate for a particular cargo is primarily used when good are insured under the terms of a floating or an open policy; at the request of the insured it can be exchanged for a policy.

530.name: Insurance policy
530.desc: Document/message issued by the insurer evidencing an agreement to insure and containing the conditions of the agreement concluded whereby the insurer undertakes for a specific fee to indemnify the insured for the losses arising out of the perils and accidents specified in the contract.

550.name: Insurance declaration sheet (bordereau)
550.desc: A document/message used when an insured reports to his insurer details of individual shipments which are covered by an insurance contract - an open cover or a floating policy - between the parties.

575.name: Insurer's invoice
575.desc: Document/message issued by an insurer specifying the cost of an insurance which has been effected and claiming payment therefore.

580.name: Cover note
580.desc: Document/message issued by an insurer (insurance broker, agent, etc.) to notify the insured that his insurance have been carried out.

610.name: Forwarding instructions
610.desc: Document/message issued to a freight forwarder, giving instructions regarding the action to be taken by the forwarder for the forwarding of goods described therein.

621.name: Forwarder's advice to import agent
621.desc: Document/message issued by a freight forwarder in an exporting country advising his counterpart in an importing country about the forwarding of goods described therein.

622.name: Forwarder's advice to exporter
622.desc: Document/message issued by a freight forwarder informing an exporter of the action taken in fulfilment of instructions received.

623.name: Forwarder's invoice
623.desc: Invoice issued by a freight forwarder specifying services rendered and costs incurred and claiming payment therefore.

624.name: Forwarder's certificate of receipt
624.desc: Non-negotiable document issued by a forwarder to certify that he has assumed control of a specified consignment, with irrevocable instructions to send it to the consignee indicated in the document or to hold it at his disposal. E.g. FIATA-FCR.

630.name: Shipping note
630.desc: Document/message provided by the shipper or his agent to the carrier, multimodal transport operator, terminal or other receiving authority, giving information about export consignments offered for transport, and providing for the necessary receipts and declarations of liability. (Sometimes a multipurpose cargo handling document also fulfilling the functions of document 632, 633, 650 and 655).

631.name: Forwarder's warehouse receipt
631.desc: Document/message issued by a forwarder acting as Warehouse Keeper acknowledging receipt of goods placed in a warehouse, and stating or referring to the conditions which govern the warehousing and the release of goods. The document contains detailed provisions regarding the rights of holders-by-endorsement, transfer of ownership, etc. E.g. FIATA-FWR.

632.name: Goods receipt
632.desc: Document/message issued by a port, warehouse/shed, or terminal operator acknowledging receipt of goods specified therein on conditions stated or referred to in the document.

633.name: Port charges documents
633.desc: Documents/messages specifying services rendered, storage and handling costs, demurrage and other charges due to the owner of goods described therein.

635.name: Warehouse warrant
635.desc: Negotiable receipt document, issued by a Warehouse Keeper to a person placing goods in a warehouse and conferring title to the goods stored.

640.name: Delivery order
640.desc: Document/message issued by a party entitled to authorize the release of goods specified therein to a named consignee, to be retained by the custodian of the goods.

650.name: Handling order
650.desc: Document/message issued by a cargo handling organization (port administration, terminal operator, etc.) for the removal or other handling of goods under their care.

655.name: Gate pass
655.desc: Document/message authorizing goods specified therein to be brought out of a fenced-in port or terminal area.

700.name: Waybill
700.desc: Non-negotiable document evidencing the contract for the transport of cargo.

701.name: Universal (multipurpose) transport document
701.desc: Document/message evidencing a contract of carriage covering the movement of goods by any mode of transport, or combination of modes, for national as well as international transport, under any applicable international convention or national law and under the conditions of carriage of any carrier or transport operator undertaking or arranging the transport referred to in the document.

702.name: Goods receipt, carriage
702.desc: Document/message issued by a carrier or a carrier's agent, acknowledging receipt for carriage of goods specified therein on conditions stated or referred to in the document, enabling the carrier to issue a transport document.

703.name: House waybill
703.desc: The document made out by an agent/consolidator which evidences the contract between the shipper and the agent/consolidator for the arrangement of carriage of goods.

704.name: Master bill of lading
704.desc: A bill of lading issued by the master of a vessel (in actuality the owner or charterer of the vessel). It could cover a number of house bills.

705.name: Bill of lading
705.desc: Negotiable document/message which evidences a contract of carriage by sea and the taking over or loading of goods by carrier, and by which carrier undertakes to deliver goods against surrender of the document. A provision in the document that goods are to be delivered to the order of a named person, or to order, or to bearer, constitutes such an undertaking.

706.name: Bill of lading original
706.desc: The original of the bill of lading issued by a transport company. When issued by the maritime industry it could signify ownership of the cargo.

707.name: Bill of lading copy
707.desc: A copy of the bill of lading issued by a transport company.

708.name: Empty container bill
708.desc: Bill of lading indicating an empty container.

709.name: Tanker bill of lading
709.desc: Document which evidences a transport of liquid bulk cargo.

710.name: Sea waybill
710.desc: Non-negotiable document which evidences a contract for the carriage of goods by sea and the taking over of the goods by the carrier, and by which the carrier undertakes to deliver the goods to the consignee named in the document.

711.name: Inland waterway bill of lading
711.desc: Negotiable transport document made out to a named person, to order or to bearer, signed by the carrier and handed to the sender after receipt of the goods.

712.name: Non-negotiable maritime transport document (generic)
712.desc: Non-negotiable document which evidences a contract for the carriage of goods by sea and the taking over or loading of the goods by the carrier, and by which the carrier undertakes to deliver the goods to the consignee named in the document. E.g. Sea waybill. Remark: Synonymous with 'straight' or 'non-negotiable Bill of lading' used in certain countries, e.g. Canada.

713.name: Mate's receipt
713.desc: Document/message issued by a ship's officer to acknowledge that a specified consignment has been received on board a vessel, and the apparent condition of the goods; enabling the carrier to issue a Bill of lading.

714.name: House bill of lading
714.desc: The bill of lading issued not by the carrier but by the freight forwarder/consolidator known by the carrier.

715.name: Letter of indemnity for non-surrender of bill of lading
715.desc: Document/message issued by a commercial party or a bank of an insurance company accepting responsibility to the beneficiary of the indemnity in accordance with the terms thereof.

716.name: Forwarder's bill of lading
716.desc: Non-negotiable document issued by a freight forwarder evidencing a contract for the carriage of goods by sea and the taking over or loading of the goods by the freight forwarder, and by which the freight forwarder undertakes to deliver the goods to the consignee named in the document.

720.name: Rail consignment note (generic term)
720.desc: Transport document constituting a contract for the carriage of goods between the sender and the carrier (the railway). For international rail traffic, this document must conform to the model prescribed by the international conventions concerning carriage of goods by rail, e.g. CIM Convention, SMGS Convention.

722.name: Road list-SMGS
722.desc: Accounting document, one copy of which is drawn up for each consignment note; it accompanies the consignment over the whole route and is a rail transport document.

723.name: Escort official recognition
723.desc: Document/message which gives right to the owner to exert all functions normally transferred to a guard in a train by which an escorted consignment is transported.

724.name: Recharging document
724.desc: Fictitious transport document regarding a previous transport, enabling a carrier's agent to give to another carrier's agent (in a different country) the possibility to collect charges relating to the original transport (rail environment).

730.name: Road consignment note
730.desc: Transport document/message which evidences a contract between a carrier and a sender for the carriage of goods by road (generic term). Remark: For international road traffic, this document must contain at least the particulars prescribed by the convention on the contract for the international carriage of goods by road (CMR).

740.name: Air waybill
740.desc: Document/message made out by or on behalf of the shipper which evidences the contract between the shipper and carrier(s) for carriage of goods over routes of the carrier(s) and which is identified by the airline prefix issuing the document plus a serial (IATA).

741.name: Master air waybill
741.desc: Document/message made out by or on behalf of the agent/consolidator which evidences the contract between the agent/consolidator and carrier(s) for carriage of goods over routes of the carrier(s) for a consignment consisting of goods originated by more than one shipper (IATA).

743.name: Substitute air waybill
743.desc: A temporary air waybill which contains only limited information because of the absence of the original.

744.name: Crew's effects declaration
744.desc: Declaration to Customs regarding the personal effects of crew members aboard the conveyance; equivalent to IMO FAL 4.

745.name: Passenger list
745.desc: Declaration to Customs regarding passengers aboard the conveyance; equivalent to IMO FAL 6.

746.name: Delivery notice (rail transport)
746.desc: Document/message created by the consignor or by the departure station, joined to the transport or sent to the consignee, giving the possibility to the consignee or the arrival station to attest the delivery of the goods. The document must be returned to the consignor or to the departure station.

750.name: Despatch note (post parcels)
750.desc: Document/message which, according to Article 106 of the 'Agreement concerning Postal Parcels' under the UPU convention, is to accompany post parcels.

760.name: Multimodal/combined transport document (generic)
760.desc: A transport document used when more than one mode of transportation is involved in the movement of cargo. It is a contract of carriage and receipt of the cargo for a multimodal transport. It indicates the place where the responsible transport company in the move takes responsibility for the cargo, the place where the responsibility of this transport company in the move ends and the conveyances involved.

761.name: Through bill of lading
761.desc: Bill of lading which evidences a contract of carriage from one place to another in separate stages of which at least one stage is a sea transit, and by which the issuing carrier accepts responsibility for the carriage as set forth in the Through bill of lading.

763.name: Forwarder's certificate of transport
763.desc: Negotiable document/message issued by a forwarder to certify that he has taken charge of a specified consignment for despatch and delivery in accordance with the consignor's instructions, as indicated in the document, and that he accepts responsibility for delivery of the goods to the holder of the document through the intermediary of a delivery agent of his choice. E.g. FIATA-FCT.

764.name: Combined transport document (generic)
764.desc: Negotiable or non-negotiable document evidencing a contract for the performance and/or procurement of performance of combined transport of goods and bearing on its face either the heading 'Negotiable combined transport document issued subject to Uniform Rules for a Combined Transport Document (ICC Brochure No. 298)' or the heading 'Non-negotiable Combined Transport Document issued subject to Uniform Rules for a Combined Transport Document (ICC Brochure No. 298)'.

765.name: Multimodal transport document (generic)
765.desc: Document/message which evidences a multimodal transport contract, the taking in charge of the goods by the multimodal transport operator, and an undertaking by him to deliver the goods in accordance with the terms of the contract. (International Convention on Multimodal Transport of Goods).

766.name: Combined transport bill of lading/multimodal bill of lading
766.desc: Document which evidences a multimodal transport contract, the taking in charge of the goods by the multimodal transport operator, and an undertaking by him to deliver the goods in accordance with the terms of the contract.

770.name: Booking confirmation
770.desc: Document/message issued by a carrier to confirm that space has been reserved for a consignment in means of transport.

775.name: Calling forward notice
775.desc: Instructions for release or delivery of goods.

780.name: Freight invoice
780.desc: Document/message issued by a transport operation specifying freight costs and charges incurred for a transport operation and stating conditions of payment.

781.name: Arrival notice (goods)
781.desc: Notification from the carrier to the consignee in writing, by telephone or by any other means (express letter, message, telegram, etc.) informing him that a consignment addressed to him is being or will shortly be held at his disposal at a specified point in the place of destination.

782.name: Notice of circumstances preventing delivery (goods)
782.desc: Request made by the carrier to the sender, or, as the case may be, the consignee, for instructions as to the disposal of the consignment when circumstances prevent delivery and the return of the goods has not been requested by the consignor in the transport document.

783.name: Notice of circumstances preventing transport (goods)
783.desc: Request made by the carrier to the sender, or, the consignee as the case may be, for instructions as to the disposal of the goods when circumstances prevent transport before departure or en route, after acceptance of the consignment concerned.

784.name: Delivery notice (goods)
784.desc: Notification in writing, sent by the carrier to the sender, to inform him at his request of the actual date of delivery of the goods.

785.name: Cargo manifest
785.desc: Listing of goods comprising the cargo carried in a means of transport or in a transport-unit. The cargo manifest gives the commercial particulars of the goods, such as transport document numbers, consignors, consignees, shipping marks, number and kind of packages and descriptions and quantities of the goods.

786.name: Freight manifest
786.desc: Document/message containing the same information as a cargo manifest, and additional details on freight amounts, charges, etc.

787.name: Bordereau
787.desc: Document/message used in road transport, listing the cargo carried on a road vehicle, often referring to appended copies of Road consignment note.

788.name: Container manifest (unit packing list)
788.desc: Document/message specifying the contents of particular freight containers or other transport units, prepared by the party responsible for their loading into the container or unit.

789.name: Charges note
789.desc: Document used by the rail organization to indicate freight charges or additional charges in each case where the departure station is not able to calculate the charges for the total voyage (e.g. tariff not yet updated, part of voyage not covered by the tariff). This document must be considered as joined to the transport.

790.name: Advice of collection
790.desc: Document that is joined to the transport or sent by separate means, giving to the departure rail organization the proof that the cash-on delivery amount has been encashed by the arrival rail organization before reimbursement of the consignor.

791.name: Safety of ship certificate
791.desc: Document certifying a ship's safety to a specified date.

792.name: Safety of radio certificate
792.desc: Document certifying the safety of a ship's radio facilities to a specified date.

793.name: Safety of equipment certificate
793.desc: Document certifying the safety of a ship's equipment to a specified date.

794.name: Civil liability for oil certificate
794.desc: Document declaring a ship owner's liability for oil propelling or carried on a vessel.

795.name: Loadline document
795.desc: Document specifying the limit of a ship's legal submersion under various conditions.

796.name: Derat document
796.desc: Document certifying that a ship is free of rats, valid to a specified date.

797.name: Maritime declaration of health
797.desc: Document certifying the health condition on board a vessel, valid to a specified date.

798.name: Certificate of registry
798.desc: Official certificate stating the vessel's registry.

799.name: Ship's stores declaration
799.desc: Declaration to Customs regarding the contents of the ship's stores (equivalent to IMO FAL 3) i.e. goods intended for consumption by passengers/crew on board vessels, aircraft or trains, whether or not sold or landed; goods necessary for operation/maintenance of conveyance, incl. fuel/lubricants, excl. spare parts/equipment (IMO).

810.name: Export licence, application for
810.desc: Application for a permit issued by a government authority permitting exportation of a specified commodity subject to specified conditions as quantity, country of destination, etc.

811.name: Export licence
811.desc: Permit issued by a government authority permitting exportation of a specified commodity subject to specified conditions as quantity, country of destination, etc. Synonym: Embargo permit.

812.name: Exchange control declaration, export
812.desc: Document/message completed by an exporter/seller as a means whereby the competent body may control that the amount of foreign exchange accrued from a trade transaction is repatriated in accordance with the conditions of payment and exchange control regulations in force.

821.name: Despatch note model T1
821.desc: Transit declaration for goods circulating under internal community transit procedures (between ECE countries).

822.name: Despatch note model T2
822.desc: Ascertainment that the declared goods were originally produced in an ECE country.

823.name: Control document T5
823.desc: Control document (export declaration) used particularly in case of re-sending without use with only VAT collection, refusal, unconformity with contract etc.

824.name: Re-sending consignment note
824.desc: Rail consignment note prepared by the consignor for the facilitation of an eventual return to the origin of the goods.

825.name: Despatch note model T2L
825.desc: Ascertainment that the declared goods were originally produced in an EC country. May only be used for goods that are loaded on one single means of transport in one single departure point for one single delivery point.

830.name: Goods declaration for exportation
830.desc: Document/message by which goods are declared for export Customs clearance, conforming to the layout key set out at Appendix I to Annex C.1 concerning outright exportation to the Kyoto convention (CCC). Within a Customs union, 'for despatch' may have the same meaning as 'for exportation'.

833.name: Cargo declaration (departure)
833.desc: Generic term, sometimes referred to as Freight declaration, applied to the documents providing the particulars required by the Customs concerning the cargo (freight) carried by commercial means of transport (CCC).

840.name: Application for goods control certificate
840.desc: Document/message submitted to a competent body by party requesting a Goods control certificate to be issued in accordance with national or international standards, or conforming to legislation in the importing country, or as specified in the contract.

841.name: Goods control certificate
841.desc: Document/message issued by a competent body evidencing the quality of the goods described therein, in accordance with national or international standards, or conforming to legislation in the importing country, or as specified in the contract.

850.name: Application for phytosanitary certificate
850.desc: Document/message submitted to a competent body by party requesting a Phytosanitary certificate to be issued.

851.name: Phytosanitary certificate
851.desc: Document/message issued by the competent body in the exporting country evidencing that plants, fruit, or vegetables are free from disease and fit for consumption and giving details on fumigation or other treatment to which they may have been subjected.

852.name: Sanitary certificate
852.desc: Document/message issued by the competent authority in the exporting country evidencing that alimentary and animal products, including dead animals, are fit for human consumption, and giving details, when relevant, of controls undertaken.

853.name: Veterinary certificate
853.desc: Document/message issued by the competent authority in the exporting country evidencing that live animals or birds are not infested or infected with disease, and giving details regarding their provenance, and of vaccinations and other treatment to which they have been subjected.

855.name: Application for inspection certificate
855.desc: Document/message submitted to a competent body by a party requesting an Inspection certificate to be issued in accordance with national or international standards, or conforming to legislation in the country in which it is required, or as specified in the contract.

856.name: Inspection certificate
856.desc: Document/message issued by a competent body evidencing that the goods described therein have been inspected in accordance with national or international standards, in conformity with legislation in the country in which the inspection is required, or as specified in the contract.

860.name: Certificate of origin, application for
860.desc: Document/message submitted to a competent body by an interested party requesting a Certificate of origin to be issued in accordance with relevant criteria, and on the basis of evidence of the origin of the goods.

861.name: Certificate of origin
861.desc: Document/message identifying goods, in which the authority or body authorized to issue it certifies expressly that the goods to which the certificate relates originate in a specific country. The word 'country' may include a group of countries, a region or a part of a country. This certificate may also include a declaration by the manufacturer, producer, supplier, exporter or other competent person.

862.name: Declaration of origin
862.desc: Appropriate statement as to the origin of the goods, made in connection with their exportation by the manufacturer, producer, supplier, exporter or other competent person on the Commercial invoice or any other document relating to the goods (CCC).

863.name: Regional appellation certificate
863.desc: Certificate drawn up in accordance with the rules laid down by an authority or approved body, certifying that the goods described therein qualify for a designation specific to the given region (e.g. champagne, port wine, Parmesan cheese).

865.name: Certificate of origin form GSP
865.desc: Specific form of certificate of origin for goods qualifying for preferential treatment under the generalized system of preferences (includes a combined declaration of origin and certificate, form A).

870.name: Consular invoice
870.desc: Document/message to be prepared by an exporter in his country and presented to a diplomatic representation of the importing country for endorsement and subsequently to be presented by the importer in connection with the import of the goods described therein.

890.name: Dangerous goods declaration
890.desc: Document/message issued by a consignor in accordance with applicable conventions or regulations, describing hazardous goods or materials for transport purposes, and stating that the latter have been packed and labelled in accordance with the provisions of the relevant conventions or regulations.

895.name: Statistical document, export
895.desc: Document/message in which an exporter provides information about exported goods required by the body responsible for the collection of international trade statistics.

896.name: INTRASTAT declaration
896.desc: Document/message in which a declarant provides information about goods required by the body responsible for the collection of trade statistics.

901.name: Delivery verification certificate
901.desc: Document/message whereby an official authority (Customs or governmental) certifies that goods have been delivered.

910.name: Import licence, application for
910.desc: Document/message in which an interested party applies to the competent body for authorization to import either a limited quantity of articles subject to import restrictions, or an unlimited quantity of such articles during a limited period, and specifies the kind of articles, their origin and value, etc.

911.name: Import licence
911.desc: Document/message issued by the competent body in accordance with import regulations in force, by which authorization is granted to a named party to import either a limited quantity of designated articles or an unlimited quantity of such articles during a limited period, under conditions specified in the document.

913.name: Customs declaration without commercial detail
913.desc: CUSDEC transmission that does not include data from the commercial detail section of the message.

914.name: Customs declaration with commercial and item detail
914.desc: CUSDEC transmission that includes data from both the commercial detail and item detail sections of the message.

915.name: Customs declaration without item detail
915.desc: CUSDEC transmission that does not include data from the item detail section of the message.

925.name: Application for exchange allocation
925.desc: Document/message whereby an importer/buyer requests the competent body to allocate an amount of foreign exchange to be transferred to an exporter/seller in payment for goods.

926.name: Foreign exchange permit
926.desc: Document/message issued by the competent body authorizing an importer/buyer to transfer an amount of foreign exchange to an exporter/seller in payment for goods.

927.name: Exchange control declaration (import)
927.desc: Document/message completed by an importer/buyer as a means for the competent body to control that a trade transaction for which foreign exchange has been allocated has been executed and that money has been transferred in accordance with the conditions of payment and the exchange control regulations in force.

929.name: Goods declaration for importation
929.desc: Document/message by which goods are declared for import Customs clearance [sister entry of 830].

930.name: Goods declaration for home use
930.desc: Document/message by which goods are declared for import Customs clearance according to Annex B.1 (concerning clearance for home use) to the Kyoto convention (CCC).

931.name: Customs immediate release declaration
931.desc: Document/message issued by an importer notifying Customs that goods have been removed from an importing means of transport to the importer's premises under a Customs- approved arrangement for immediate release, or requesting authorization to do so.

932.name: Customs delivery note
932.desc: Document/message whereby a Customs authority releases goods under its control to be placed at the disposal of the party concerned. Synonym: Customs release note.

933.name: Cargo declaration (arrival)
933.desc: Generic term, sometimes referred to as Freight declaration, applied to the documents providing the particulars required by the Customs concerning the cargo (freight) carried by commercial means of transport (CCC).

934.name: Value declaration
934.desc: Document/message in which a declarant (importer) states the invoice or other price (e.g. selling price, price of identical goods), and specifies costs for freight, insurance and packing, etc., terms of delivery and payment, any relationship with the trading partner, etc., for the purpose of determining the Customs value of goods imported.

935.name: Customs invoice
935.desc: Document/message required by the Customs in an importing country in which an exporter states the invoice or other price (e.g. selling price, price of identical goods), and specifies costs for freight, insurance and packing, etc., terms of delivery and payment, for the purpose of determining the Customs value in the importing country of goods consigned to that country.

936.name: Customs declaration (post parcels)
936.desc: Document/message which, according to Article 106 of the 'Agreement concerning Postal Parcels' under the UPU Convention, must accompany post parcels and in which the contents of such parcels are specified.

937.name: Tax declaration (value added tax)
937.desc: Document/message in which an importer states the pertinent information required by the competent body for assessment of value-added tax.

938.name: Tax declaration (general)
938.desc: Document/message containing a general tax declaration.

940.name: Tax demand
940.desc: Document/message containing the demand of tax.

941.name: Embargo permit
941.desc: Document/message giving the permission to export specified goods.

950.name: Goods declaration for Customs transit
950.desc: Document/message by which the sender declares goods for Customs transit according to Annex E.1 (concerning Customs transit) to the Kyoto convention (CCC).

951.name: TIF form
951.desc: International Customs transit document by which the sender declares goods for carriage by rail in accordance with the provisions of the 1952 International Convention to facilitate the crossing of frontiers for goods carried by rail (TIF Convention of UIC).

952.name: TIR carnet
952.desc: International Customs document (International Transit by Road), issued by a guaranteeing association approved by the Customs authorities, under the cover of which goods are carried, in most cases under Customs seal, in road vehicles and/or containers in compliance with the requirements of the Customs TIR Convention of the International Transport of Goods under cover of TIR Carnets (UN/ECE).

953.name: EC carnet
953.desc: EC customs transit document issued by EC customs authorities for transit and/or temporary user of goods within the EC.

954.name: EUR 1 certificate of origin
954.desc: Customs certificate used in preferential goods interchanges between EC countries and EC external countries.

955.name: ATA carnet
955.desc: International Customs document (Admission Temporaire / Temporary Admission) which, issued under the terms of the ATA Convention (1961), incorporates an internationally valid guarantee and may be used, in lieu of national Customs documents and as security for import duties and taxes, to cover the temporary admission of goods and, where appropriate, the transit of goods. If accepted for controlling the temporary export and reimport of goods, international guarantee does not apply (CCC).

960.name: Single administrative document
960.desc: A set of documents, replacing the various (national) forms for Customs declaration within the EC, implemented on 01-01-1988.

961.name: General response (Customs)
961.desc: General response message to permit the transfer of data from Customs to the transmitter of the previous message.

962.name: Document response (Customs)
962.desc: Document response message to permit the transfer of data from Customs to the transmitter of the previous message.

963.name: Error response (Customs)
963.desc: Error response message to permit the transfer of data from Customs to the transmitter of the previous message.

964.name: Package response (Customs)
964.desc: Package response message to permit the transfer of data from Customs to the transmitter of the previous message.

965.name: Tax calculation/confirmation response (Customs)
965.desc: Tax calculation/confirmation response message to permit the transfer of data from Customs to the transmitter of the previous message.

966.name: Quota prior allocation certificate
966.desc: Document/message issued by the competent body for prior allocation of a quota.

996.name: Application for documentary credit
996.desc: Message with application for opening of a documentary credit.

998.name: Previous Customs document/message
998.desc: Indication of the previous Customs document/message concerning the same transaction.
